product_name: Estee LauderTake It Away Makeup Remover Lotion
summary: SummaryHighlightsVeganSustainable PackagingEstÃ©e Lauder Take It Away Makeup Remover Lotion is a gentle and effective makeup remover formula that quickly removes even long-wear and waterproof makeup. The unique water-based lotion rinses away easily and leaves skin feeling soft and smooth with no oily residue.
details: DetailsBenefitsQuickly and gently sweeps away makeup, even the most stubbornA unique water-based makeup remover lotion that leaves behind no oily residue or greasy feelLeaves skin feeling cared for, soft and smoothRefreshes with a crisp citrus scentItem 2309331How To UseApply makeup remover to dry skin and massage well. Rinse or tissue off.Follow with your EstÃ©e Lauder cleanser and the rest of your skincare regimen.IngredientsWater / Aqua / Eau, Cyclopentasiloxane, Isohexadecane, Cucumis Sativus (Cucumber) Fruit Extract, Rosa Damascena (Rose) Flower Water, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Juice, PEG-4 Dilaurate, Butylene Glycol, Dimethicone, Lauryl Methyl Gluceth-10 Hydroxypropyldimonium Chloride, Potassium Phosphate, Sodium Chloride, Hexylene Glycol, Dipotassium Phosphate, Dipotassium EDTA, Phenoxyethanol.Please be aware that ingredient lists may change or vary from time to time. Please refer to the ingredient list on the product package you receive for the most up to date list of ingredients.Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details

ingredients: Phenoxyethanol.Please be aware that ingredient lists may change or vary from time to time. Please refer to the ingredient list on the product package you receive for the most up to date list of ingredients

reviews.headline: Eh
reviews.comments: Smell is off putting, smells extremely strong like a mens deodorant/ cologne. Consistency is weird/watery, have to use a lot of product to remove eye makeup. Only con to this product is that it doesnt have any pore clogging ingredients, just feel like theres better on the market for cheaper.

reviews.headline: Works well, leaves skin soft
reviews.comments: I use Mac eyeliner pot, that stuff is pretty hard to get off. This takes it off and the rest of my makeup and leaves my skin soft. I dont usually wash my face after either, I just go to bed and I haven't been breaking out or having any issues. This is my 2nd bottle and im about halfway through. Its good if you are lazy, I just grab some paper towels from the kitchen and take my makeup off on the couch while im watching tv.

reviews.headline: I'm not sure about all of the positive reviews
reviews.comments: I guess if you don't wear mascara you might like this cleanser.  After using it there was still so much residue on my towel.

reviews.headline: Doesn't make eyes foggy
reviews.comments: This is my favorite makeup remover! It removes waterproof mascara, leaves the skin soft, and doesn't make my eyes foggy like other makeup balm removers

reviews.headline: Men's Deodorant
reviews.comments:
Glad I only got a sample size, because the smell is CRAZY- its like a mens deodorant. Strong, too.
The product works okay and doesnt seem to cayse breakouts or anything but I just can't get past the weird cologne-ish strong manly smell.

reviews.headline: Just didn't work
reviews.comments: It was like water, it was so ineffective

reviews.headline: Best make up remover
reviews.comments: I am 74 and in my opinion this is the best make up remover I have ever used , it leaves my skin soft and not dry

reviews.headline: I buy it again and again
reviews.comments: I have used this product for about 10 years. It's my go to eye makeup remover. It removes all traces of makeup, waterproof and eye shadow that's meant to stay on 16 hours or more. It does not cause any irritation. My daughter and I both use it.

reviews.headline: broke me out after regular use
reviews.comments: I used a sample size before buying the full size and thought I liked this product, but after using it more regularly it majorly irritated my skin. I always used it as the first step of a double cleanse followed by a gentle cleanser. After a couple weeks, I broke out and developed dry patches across most of my face. After I stopped using this cleanser the acne cleared back up.

reviews.headline: Bad cleanser
reviews.comments:
- Too much fragrance 
- Does not remove makeup properly 
- leaves weird residue 

This cleanser broke me out as well :(

reviews.headline: Love it!
reviews.comments: I never use face lotion because they always clog my pores.  Just tried this for the first time and I love it!  Cleansed the makeup and left my face soft and yet it doesn't feel like there's anything on it.

reviews.headline: worst eye makeup remover
reviews.comments: doesn't remove waterproof nor regular mascara. super thick. just no.

reviews.headline: FINALLY!
reviews.comments:
This is my holy-grail when it comes to makeup removers. I've tried balms in the past but hate how they blur my vision. Micellar Water requires waaay too much rubbing and I always lost a bunch of eyelashes! It was getting to the point where I didn't even want to wear mascara anymore because I didn't want to lose all of my lashes. 

I finally decided to give this product a try (because obviously it's on the pricier side, I was hesitant) and WOW! I put a dab on my finger tip and rub gently along my lashes for a couple of seconds, then use a slightly damp cotton pad to gently wipe it all off and ta-da! No more makeup left behind! And no lashes lost! 

Seriously, you need to try this. Please keep selling this product forever!! It's expensive, but the bottle is big and will last a while, especially since I use such a tiny amount on my eyes.

reviews.headline: Gentle but unnecessary frangrence
reviews.comments: It works I can be pretty gentle and still get everything off. Mascara you have to work at a little more but all of my eyelashes are intact (Micellar water I definitely lose a lash or 2 everytime) I have rosacea so frangrence bothers my skin normally.. if I follow with cleanser immediately after I'm fine I don't get irritated! If i do something else in between I do get pretty red. I just don't get why companies use fragrance still. I'll keep using this but once I run out I will probably find something else

reviews.headline: It works well
reviews.comments: I can't believe anyone could say this stuff doesn't work. I wear heavy eye make up on occasion as well as foundation. This product does a very good job of removing it with a lot less effort than many others I have used. I love that it doesn't leave a greasy residue as well. I would give it a 5 star rating, but its quite pricey.

reviews.headline: Takes nothing away!
reviews.comments: Even washing my face twice with this lotion did NOT remove my makeup, especially my eye makeup. It just smeared it around - and I don't wear heavy makeup or waterproof mascara. I had to use a separate cleanser and my Clinique Take the Day Off for Lips, Lashes and Lids to thoroughly clean my face and remove the smeared mascara. I tried this for nearly a week, and every time the same issues. So frustrating. In addition, this lotion has an added fragrance that smells like grandma's cheap perfume.

reviews.headline: yesss!
reviews.comments: So ive been looking for a makeup remover that doesnt make me feel like i wiped oil all over my face. Ive tried so many different removers its terrible. So its putting a lotion that removes your make up. It doesnt leave a nasty oily face. I cant use oil removers because it just grosses me out. This one is amazing though. It cleans but does make my skin feel hydrated but not overly so. It has a light, pleasant smell and i need 3 max pumps to clean my entire face. This is definitely my go to make up remover.

reviews.headline: My holy grail makeup remover
reviews.comments: I've been using this makeup remover for as long as I can remember. It is the best one ever! No oily residue and takes off makeup like a pro. Also does not break me out. 10/10 recommend!

reviews.headline: Not The Best!
reviews.comments: I used to love this when I worked for EstÃ©e Lauder but I have found better balms and oils from Clinique at a better price point. I wear Double Wear heavy so I fly through this stuff. I also find this drying and the texture is to slick. It slides out my hand! The price point is just to high for the amount!

reviews.headline: 10+ Years!
reviews.comments: I started using this over 10 years ago. I've tried other products because I have to order this online only now. But always come back. IT IS THE BEST! It does not irritate my sensitive skin around my eyes. It does take off caked on makeup (with an extra pump ðŸ˜œ). It takes off lash glue, waterproof mascara and eyeliners. It is so smooth you gently massage in like lotion to let it break down the makeup then wipe away your sins ðŸ˜†. I have been recommending this product for years! I will continue to do so because there is nothing out there that works better AND treats my skin nicer. I hope you think so too.

properties.name: Best Uses

values.label: complete makeup removal prior to cleansing

display_values: complete makeup removal prior to cleansing

faceoff_positive.comments: This works so much better than oily eye makeup remover at removing mascara and eyeliner, even waterproof varieties.  Because I don't have to use a cotton ball and don't have to rub hard, my eyelashes stay much healthier and fuller.  And on the rest of my face, it rinses clean, and I don't have to use a cleanser after I use this product.  Just rub gently onto face with fingertips, rinse off, and go to bed.  It is a minor thing, but the pump dispenser also makes this product easier to use than a product with a screw top.  No fumbling to recap a bottle or jar with greasy fingers, like I have to do with other makeup removers.  And it totally removes the makeup without drying or irritating my sensitive skin.
faceoff_positive.headline: Absolute favorite

faceoff_negative.comments: I bought it based on the great reviews on here, but for me it didn't perform well. The texture is creamy but in an oily kind of way which requires me to use more than I would if I was using a cleansing oil instead, and the fragrance isn't great but not horrible either if the product performed. When I use it, I find myself having to triple clean my face after using this product - when I use this, I then wash my face and then use micellar water to remove the left over makeup because this does a poor job at removing it. I do use Bite Beauty Mascara and NARS foundation, perhaps that's why it won't perform on me. Unfortunately I didn't return it, so now I have it as a last resort because is too many steps to clean my face using this product.
faceoff_negative.headline: Not sure what's the all they hype about

rollup.name: Take It Away Makeup Remover Lotion
